summary: The 'Investing in All of America Act of 2025' amends the Small Business Investment Act of 1958. It aims to exclude certain investments from the leverage limits for Small Business Investment Companies (SBICs). Specifically, it focuses on investments in smaller enterprises located in rural or low-income areas, small businesses in critical technology areas, and small manufacturers. The bill also includes provisions for adjusting dollar amounts related to leverage exclusions based on the Consumer Price Index.
